name: garage-bAInd/Open-Platypus
description: The Open-Platypus dataset is a valuable tool for anyone interested in advancing the capabilities of large language models. It is a collection of five datasets: PRM800K, MATH, ScienceQA, SciBench, ReClor, and TheoremQA, each with its own licensing terms. The datasets were filtered to remove questions with a high degree of similarity, ensuring a diverse and original set of questions. This dataset was used in the training of the Platypus2 models, showcasing its potential in improving the logical reasoning skills of these models.
citeAs: @article{platypus2023,     title={Platypus: Quick, Cheap, and Powerful Refinement of LLMs},      author={Ariel N. Lee and Cole J. Hunter and Nataniel Ruiz},     booktitle={arXiv preprint arxiv:2308.07317},     year={2023} }
creator: garage-bAInd
keywords: Logical Reasoning, Machine Learning Models, Question Answering Datasets
